item.title: BCCI cracks whip, makes domestic cricket participation mandatory in 10-point diktat; lists IPL ban as part of punishment - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BCCI Cracks Whip on Domestic Cricket Participation

Date: Jan 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In response to recent poor performances, the BCCI has announced stricter protocols for the Indian cricket team, prioritizing domestic cricket participation and imposing several restrictions to enhance team discipline.

  • Mandatory participation in domestic cricket for players to be eligible for national selection.
  • Restriction on family and personal staff presence during tours.
  • Bar on individual endorsements during series.
  • Only a two-week window allowed for family visits during overseas tours.
  • Disciplinary actions will be taken against non-compliance, including potential bans from the IPL.
“Any exceptions or deviations must be pre-approved by the Chairman of the Selection Committee and Head Coach. Non-compliance may lead to disciplinary action as deemed appropriate by the BCCI,”

These measures aim to create a focused and disciplined environment for the players to enhance their performance on the pitch.

item.title: Infosys ADR falls 6% overnight post Q3 results, will Indian shares follow suit? - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Infosys ADR Falls 6% Overnight After Q3 Results

Published on: Jan 17, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The American Depository Receipts (ADRs) of Infosys Ltd fell by 6% overnight after the company announced its December quarter results. Despite revising revenue growth guidance higher for the third consecutive quarter, the shares declined.

  • Infosys revised its revenue growth forecast for FY2025 to 4.5%-5% from 3.75%-4.5%.
  • The EBIT margin guidance remains unchanged at 20%-22%.
  • Infosys shares in India dropped 1.5% just before the earnings announcement.
  • Organic Services revenue fell by 0.9% sequentially.
  • Revenue from the top five clients decreased by 6.4% in US Dollar terms.
  • Attrition rate increased to 13.7%, with expectations of worsening conditions.
  • The company secured $2.5 billion in new deals for the quarter, despite a 32% drop in Total Contract Value year-on-year.
“Infosys won deals worth $2.5 billion in the quarter... yet the nine-month Total Contract Value is down 32% year-on-year.”

The significant fall in ADRs raises concerns about how Indian shares might respond in the coming days.

item.title: BCCI issues curbs on personal staff, family travel, endorsement shoots during tours for centrally-contracted cricketers; violators may face IPL ban - The Indian Express
item.description:
BCCI issues curbs on personal staff, family travel, endorsement shoots during tours for centrally-contracted cricketers; violators may face IPL ban

Date: January 17, 2025 - Source: The Indian Express

The BCCI has introduced ten new guidelines for centrally-contracted players following a review meeting after their defeat in Australia. These guidelines impose strict rules on family travel, personal staff, endorsement work, and player discipline during tours.

  • Mandatory participation in domestic tournaments for selection.
  • Restrictions on family travel and personal staff presence during tours.
  • Players prohibited from returning home prematurely or engaging in endorsement shoots during tours.
  • Enforcement of unity and discipline within the team dynamic.
  • Players required to travel only with the team.
  • Families allowed on tours for a maximum of 14 days if the tour exceeds 45 days.
  • Attendance at all practice sessions is now mandatory.
“Players must stay with the team until the scheduled end of the match series or tour, even if matches conclude earlier than planned. This ensures unity, fosters team bonding, and avoids disruption to team dynamics.”

These measures aim to strengthen team cohesion and discipline among players.

item.title: India: Wearable Tech Mimics Pain to Detect Stress - OpenGov Asia
item.description:
Wearable Tech Mimics Pain to Detect Stress

Publication Date: Unknown Source: OpenGov Asia

Scientists from JNCASR in Bengaluru have developed a wearable device that senses stress by mimicking the human body's response to pain, paving the way for efficient health monitoring systems.

  • The device uses a silver wire network embedded in stretchable material.
  • It detects strain and learns from it, mimicking pain responses seen in the human body.
  • This adaptive ability allows it to adjust its electrical response over time.
  • The technology could transform healthcare and robotics by providing real-time stress detection.
  • It's inspired by nociceptors, which detect pain and trigger protective responses.
  • Published in Materials Horizons by the Royal Society of Chemistry.
“This novel wearable device represents a significant step forward in the development of more intelligent, adaptable technology.”

This development signifies a major leap in creating technology that is more aligned with human physiological responses, enhancing the possibilities of healthcare and robotic applications.

item.title: realme 14 pro series introduces world’s first cold-sensitive smartphones that change color - Designboom
item.description:
realme 14 Pro Series Launches World's First Color-Changing Cold-Sensitive Smartphones

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: Designboom

realme introduces its 14 Pro Series as the first smartphones that change color when exposed to cold, featuring a unique pearl white texture that transforms into marbled blue in low temperatures.

  • The smartphone starts changing color below 16 degrees Celsius.
  • Designed in collaboration with Nordic industrial design studio Valeur Designers.
  • Equipped with advanced cooling systems and AI eye protection algorithms.
  • The smartphones have IP69 waterproof ratings, functioning after being submerged for 48 hours.
  • Battery life supports up to 10 hours of gaming and rapid charging capabilities.
  • Camera features include Sony OIS technology with up to 50 megapixels.
“The devices can still work ‘just like before’ even after 48 hours under two meters of water.”

This innovative smartphone not only emphasizes aesthetic appeal with its color-changing capabilities but also incorporates durable design elements suitable for active use.

item.title: 8th Pay Commission For Govt Employees, Pensioners Gets Cabinet Approval | Check Details - News18
item.description:
8th Pay Commission For Govt Employees, Pensioners Gets Cabinet Approval | Check Details

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: News18

The Union Cabinet has approved the formation of the 8th Central Pay Commission, which will evaluate salary adjustments for more than one crore central government employees and pensioners, with a report expected by 2026.

  • The commission comes into effect on January 1, 2026.
  • It is expected to benefit around 50 lakh employees and 65 lakh pensioners.
  • There will be a significant economic impact, boosting consumption and quality of life for government employees.
  • The expected salary increase may be up to 186% for minimum salaries, pending the commission's report.
  • The last pay commission was implemented in 2016 and the 8th commission was announced before the Union Budget 2025-26.
“Prime Minister approves the 8th Central Pay Commission for all employees of the Central Government.”

This decision reflects the government's ongoing commitment to reviewing and improving employee compensation in response to changing economic conditions.

item.title: Tanzania says no sign of Marburg outbreak in the country - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tanzania Reports No Signs of Marburg Virus Outbreak Despite WHO Concerns

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Tanzania's government has reported that no individuals have tested positive for the Marburg virus, despite the World Health Organization indicating that at least eight deaths were suspected due to the virus.

  • The Tanzanian health minister stated that laboratory results for all suspected cases were negative as of January 15, 2025.
  • Reports indicate possible cases in Kagera, Tanzania, as of January 10, 2025.
  • Marburg symptoms include high fever, muscle weakness, and vomiting blood, with a fatality rate as high as 88%.
  • After the reports, Tanzania deployed a team of experts to investigate and collect specimens.
  • The country previously faced a Marburg outbreak in 2023, with nine cases and six deaths recorded.
  • The Tanzanian government has strengthened disease surveillance systems in response to the recent reports.
  • Tanzania faced criticism during the COVID-19 pandemic for a lack of transparency regarding data sharing and preventive measures.
"As of 15th January 2025, laboratory results for all suspected individuals were negative for Marburg virus." - Jenista Mhagama, Health Minister

The Tanzanian government appears to be taking proactive measures following suspicions of a Marburg outbreak, reaffirming the commitment to enhanced disease surveillance and preparedness.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi is in complete grip of urban Naxal thinking: Ravi Shankar Prasad - The Times of India
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi is in complete grip of urban Naxal thinking: Ravi Shankar Prasad

Published on: (date not provided) Source: Times of India

In recent statements, Ravi Shankar Prasad criticized Rahul Gandhi, claiming that his political views are heavily influenced by urban Naxal ideology.

  • Ravi Shankar Prasad accuses Rahul Gandhi of promoting divisive politics.
  • Comments made during a political event highlighting the need for unified national integrity.
  • Prasad urges the public to be cautious of ideologies that disrupt social harmony.
“Rahul’s thought process is clouded by urban Naxalism,” stated Prasad during the address.

In conclusion, Prasad’s remarks reflect ongoing political tensions and the importance of cohesive national ideology.

item.title: Closure of Hindenburg Research not a clean chit for Adani, PM Modi: Jairam Ramesh - The Times of India
item.description:
Closure of Hindenburg Research not a clean chit for Adani, PM Modi: Jairam Ramesh

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

This article discusses the implications of Hindenburg Research's closure and its impact on Adani and Prime Minister Modi, as articulated by Congress leader Jairam Ramesh.

  • Jairam Ramesh asserts that the closure does not absolve Adani or PM Modi of their responsibilities.
  • He emphasizes the need for accountability in corporate governance.
  • The article touches on the ongoing political and corporate narratives surrounding Adani Group.
“The closure of Hindenburg Research should not be seen as a clean chit for anyone involved.”

This piece highlights the importance of vigilance in corporate oversight and questions the implications of financial research firms’ actions on corporate accountability.

item.title: Reliance Retail Q3 Results: Net profit up 10% to ₹3,485 crore, revenue up 7% YoY led by festive season - Mint
item.description:
Reliance Retail Q3 Results: Net profit up 10% to ₹3,485 crore, revenue up 7% YoY led by festive season

Publication Date: December quarter results

New Delhi: Reliance Industries Ltd. reports growth driven by the successful performance of its Campa and Independence brands.

  • Net profit increased by 10% to ₹3,485 crore.
  • Revenue rose by 7% year-on-year to ₹90,333 crore.
  • Campa beverage brand capturing over 10% market share in sparkling drinks.
  • RCPL achieved ₹8,000 crore revenue over 9 months in FY25.
  • Expansion in various consumer goods categories, including staples and beverages.
  • Reliance opened 779 new stores, totaling 19,102 across India.
“Reliance Retail delivered strong performance during the quarter led by festive buying across consumption baskets.” - Isha M. Ambani

With new launches and strategic partnerships, Reliance is set to strengthen its market position further.

item.title: BCCI bars India players from taking personal hairstylists, chefs, security guards on tours | New guidelines come after India's loss in BGT | Inshorts - Inshorts
item.description:
BCCI bars India players from taking personal hairstylists, chefs, security guards on tours

Published: 02:31 pm on Thursday 16 January, 2025 | Source: Inshorts

The BCCI has implemented new guidelines prohibiting Indian cricketers from taking personal staff, such as hairstylists, chefs, and security guards, on international tours. This decision follows India's recent loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • New guidelines by BCCI aim to enhance team professionalism.
  • Players are required to use official team transport for matches and practice.
  • The move seeks to foster a more unified team culture.
“These measures are put in place to maintain a professional environment.” - BCCI Official

This initiative marks a shift towards greater discipline among players in their approach to international competitions.

item.title: Saif Ali Khan Attacked News Updates: "Still Trying To Process...": Kareena Kapoor After Attack On Saif Ali Khan - NDTV
item.description:
Kareena Kapoor Responds to Saif Ali Khan's Knife Attack

Publication Date: January 16, 2025

Source: NDTV

The attack on Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan has left both friends and family in a state of shock. Kareena Kapoor Khan shared her struggles in processing the day’s traumatic events.

  • Saif Ali Khan was attacked at his residence in Mumbai, suffering six stab wounds.
  • He underwent a five-hour surgery and is reported to be out of danger.
  • Family and friends have rushed to his side at the hospital, expressing their support on social media.
  • Maharashtra Minister Ashish Shelar emphasized the need for ensuring the family's recovery from this trauma.
  • Police investigations are ongoing, with multiple teams set to apprehend the attacker.
  • Concerns over safety in Mumbai have been raised by various political figures following the incident.
“We are still trying to process the events that have unfolded.” — Kareena Kapoor

This incident not only highlights the increasing concern regarding celebrity safety but reflects broader issues of law and order in Mumbai.

item.description:
Here is the list of OTT movies and series releasing this week

item.title: Cancer deaths decline in US, but rates among women and young adults are rising: Report - The Times of India
item.description:
Cancer deaths decline in US, but rates among women and young adults are rising: Report

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: American Cancer Society

Overall deaths from cancer are reducing in the United States, however cancer mortality is climbing among women, especially younger ones, while cancer diagnoses have also shot up among young people, according to a new report from the American Cancer Society.

  • The cancer mortality rate has fallen by 34% from 1991 to 2022, resulting in around 4.5 million fewer deaths.
  • Cancer rates among women aged 50 to 64 have now surpassed those of men.
  • Among women under 50, rates are 82% higher than in men.
  • Colorectal cancer cases in people under 45 and cervical cancer in women under 45 are on the rise.
  • While childhood cancer incidence is on the decline, it is still rising among adolescents aged 15 to 19.
"The report predicts 2,041,910 new cancer diagnoses in the US or about 5,600 new cases each day and 618,120 cancer deaths."

The trends highlighted in the report indicate that while progress has been made in reducing cancer deaths, certain demographics, particularly young women and specific cancers, are experiencing alarming increases in incidence and mortality rates.

item.title: Israel strikes Gaza and accuses Hamas of backtracking on deal - The Hindu
item.description:
Israel Strikes Gaza and Accuses Hamas of Backtracking on Deal

Publication Date: January 16, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Israel conducted airstrikes on Gaza, accusing Hamas of backtracking on a ceasefire and hostage release agreement that was to take effect on January 19, 2025.

  • The proposed truce involved an exchange of Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners.
  • Accusations arose from Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu about Hamas reneging on the agreement.
  • Over 75 were reported dead in Gaza due to the airstrikes following the announcement of the deal.
  • The ongoing conflict has resulted in significant casualties, with about 46,788 reported deaths in Gaza since the outbreak of hostilities.
  • Public opinion in both Gaza and Israel reflected mixed feelings, swinging between hope for peace and anguish over continued violence.
“It was the happiest night since October 7 until we received the news of the martyrdom of 40 people from the Alloush family,” said a resident of Gaza.

The article discusses the precarious situation as efforts continue to stabilize the truce, balancing between political negotiations and the humanitarian crisis exacerbated by the recent escalations.

item.title: Drinking Green Tea Daily Can Help In Keeping Your Brain Healthy, Reveals Study - News18
item.description:
Drinking Green Tea Daily Can Help In Keeping Your Brain Healthy, Reveals Study

Publication Date: January 16, 2025, Source: News18

Consumption of green tea can help maintain good brain health, according to a study published in npj Science of Food. This research suggests that green tea has protective benefits for cognitive functions as we age.

The Impact of Green Tea on Brain Health

  • Green tea is recognized for its weight loss benefits and now for supporting brain health.
  • The study indicates green tea may safeguard cognitive functions and prevent age-related decline.
  • Participants drinking 600 ml of green tea daily had 3% less brain damage than those who drank 200 ml or less.
  • Green tea contains antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds like epigallocatechin gallate.
  • In comparison, coffee did not significantly reduce white matter lesions.
“This suggests that drinking about three cups of green tea a day could be beneficial.”

The findings highlight the potential of green tea as a simple dietary addition for enhanced brain health and cognitive protection.

item.title: Cancer cases rising for women and younger adults in US, report finds - The Guardian
item.description:
Cancer cases rising for women and younger adults in US, report finds

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: American Cancer Society

Certain types of cancer, especially among women and younger adults, are on the rise according to a new report from the American Cancer Society. This marks a significant shift in cancer trends, particularly highlighting a higher diagnosis rate among women than men.

  • The report analyzes cancer rates in the US from 1991 to 2021.
  • For the first time since the early 1900s, cancer diagnoses in women under 65 have surpassed those in men of the same age group.
  • Over 2 million new cancer cases and 618,000 cancer deaths are anticipated this year.
  • Breast cancer and thyroid cancer are notable increases for women.
  • Native Americans are at a higher risk for certain cancers compared to white populations.
  • Cancer mortality has decreased by 34% since 1991, largely due to technological advances and improved detection.
“Cancer is the number one leading cause of death for all folks under the age of 85,” - William Dahut, chief scientific officer for ACS.

While the trends are concerning, the report points to progress in reducing cancer mortality through early detection and a societal decline in smoking. Continued efforts are essential to address disparities in cancer care.

item.title: Saif Ali Khan Attacked News Live Updates: "Still Trying To Process...": Kareena Kapoor After Attack On Saif Ali Khan - NDTV
item.description:
Kareena Kapoor Reacts to Saif Ali Khan's Attack: Family and Friends Rally for Support

Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV

Following a violent incident involving Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan, family and friends have come together to support him as he recuperates from a knife attack that occurred at his residence.

  • Saif underwent a five-hour surgery at Lilavati Hospital after sustaining six stab wounds.
  • Kareena Kapoor described the day as "incredibly challenging" and expressed the difficulty in processing the events.
  • Friends, including Riddhima Kapoor and Kunal Kohli, expressed their support on social media, voicing concern for Saif and his family.
  • Maharashtra Minister Ashish Shelar urged a focus on the family's recovery from trauma and condemned the act as serious.
  • Police are actively investigating the incident, searching for the attacker and reviewing CCTV footage.
"My thoughts are with the entire family," said West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

The shocking attack has raised broader concerns regarding security in Mumbai, with several political figures commenting on the implications for public safety.

item.title: Gujarat Giants vs RCB to kick off WPL 2025 on February 14 in Vadodara; final in Mumbai - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
WPL 2025 to Start on February 14 with Gujarat Giants vs RCB

Date: February 14, 2025 Source: ESPNcricinfo

WPL 2025 will commence with Gujarat Giants hosting Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the newly built BCA stadium in Vadodara. The tournament includes multiple venues such as Lucknow and Mumbai.

  • First six games in Vadodara, then move to Bengaluru.
  • Lucknow to host four matches and Mumbai to stage the final on March 15.
  • RCB will play four home games at Chinnaswamy Stadium.
“The WPL 2025 auction turned out to be a big deal for uncapped Indian players.”

RCB clinched their first WPL title in 2024 after beating Delhi Capitals.

item.title: Paatal Lok Season 2 Release Time: Here’s When Jaideep Ahlawat’s Crime Thriller Premiere On Prime Video - Filmibeat
item.description:
Paatal Lok Season 2 Release Time: Here’s When Jaideep Ahlawat’s Crime Thriller Premieres On Prime Video

Published: Thursday, January 16, 2025, 22:51 [IST]

The highly anticipated second season of the crime thriller Paatal Lok, starring Jaideep Ahlawat, will premiere on January 17 on Prime Video, captivating fans with a new gripping case set in Nagaland.

  • Jaideep Ahlawat reprises his role as Inspector Hathiram Chowdhary.
  • Gul Panag returns as Renu Chaudhary.
  • The new season navigates a fresh, intriguing case.
  • Available exclusively on Prime Video for subscribers.
“As fans have been waiting for Paatal Lok Season 2 with a bated breath, the wait is set to be over.”

With the release at midnight on January 17, viewers can look forward to an engaging continuation of the story.

item.title: Coldplay's Chris Martin Greets Paps With Namaste As He Arrives In Mumbai With Dakota Johnson | Watch - News18
item.description:
Chris Martin Greets Paps With Namaste As He Arrives In Mumbai With Dakota Johnson | Watch

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: News18

Coldplay’s frontman Chris Martin has landed in India, and fans couldn’t be more excited! The celebrated UK band’s lead singer was spotted at the Mumbai airport late Thursday night, accompanied by his partner and Hollywood actress Dakota Johnson, known for her roles in Fifty Shades of Grey and Madame Web.

Chris greeted the paparazzi with a humble ‘namaste,’ instantly winning hearts and generating buzz as he touched down in Mumbai for the band’s much-anticipated India leg of the Music of the Spheres World Tour.

  • Coldplay is set to perform three concerts at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai on January 18, 19, and 21.
  • The band will conclude with a grand finale at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on January 25.
  • Ahmedabad concert has drawn attention for a notice issued to Chris Martin regarding children’s safety during the event.
  • Children will not be allowed on stage or to enter the venue without ear protection due to potential health risks from high sound levels.
  • Local authorities emphasized protecting children from harmful exposure during concerts.
“I am committed to ensuring that children’s rights and health are protected. Such steps will continue to safeguard them from harmful exposure.” - Pandit Rao Dharnevar

In conclusion, Chris Martin's arrival has stirred excitement among fans, while important safety measures are being taken to protect children during the upcoming concerts.

item.title: BCCI Unveils 10-Point Diktat After Australia Debacle, Threatens "Disciplinary Action Against..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Implements Strict 10-Point Policy Following Australia's Tour Failures

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has announced a new 10-point policy aimed at promoting discipline and unity within the Indian cricket team after their recent poor performances abroad.

  • The policy enforces mandatory participation in domestic cricket.
  • Restrictions are placed on the presence of families and personal staff during tours.
  • Individual commercial endorsements are banned during ongoing series.
  • Players must seek approval from the head coach and chairman for any relaxation of policies.
  • There will be a maximum two-week allowance for families to join players on long overseas tours.
  • Players are required to adhere to specified baggage limits while traveling.
  • All players must stay for the entirety of scheduled practice sessions.
  • Players are discouraged from traveling separately with their families.
  • Disciplinary actions may be enforced for non-compliance, including fines and exclusion from IPL matches.
  • The policy aims to strengthen commitment and operational efficiency within the team.
“Any exceptions or deviations must be pre-approved by the Chairman of the Selection Committee and Head Coach. Non-compliance may lead to disciplinary action as deemed appropriate by the BCCI.”

This initiative reflects BCCI's commitment to maintaining professional standards within the sport. It seeks to reintegrate star players into the domestic cricket ecosystem, promoting long-term growth and success for Indian cricket.
